summary: An email from a forensic examiner (NYO CART Coordinator) to an unspecified recipient, providing an update on the status of digital evidence in the Epstein case. The email clarifies discrepancies in evidence counts, noting duplicate hard drives and non-evidentiary items like software CDs and unprocessable voice recorders.

persons.name: NYO CART Coordinator
persons.context: Author of the email, responsible for processing digital evidence in the Epstein case, clarifying inventory discrepancies.

events.title: Evidence Status Update
events.description: Forensic examiner sends an email with an attached spreadsheet detailing the status of digital evidence in the Epstein case, addressing concerns from the US Attorney's Office about discrepancies.

locations: NY (New York, specifically an apartment where evidence was collected)
keyFacts: Digital evidence collection in the Epstein case included items from an apartment in New York.
There were discrepancies in evidence counts, with 9 hard drives collected but only 3 unique drives due to duplication.
Non-evidentiary items were collected, including unprocessable voice recorders and 10 software installation CDs with no user data.
The US Attorney's Office expressed concern about evidence discrepancies, prompting this status update.
The email clarifies that a previous status report was not exhaustive, only covering items the examiner had personally handled.
